summary: The Integrity in Government Act of 2025 (H.R. 3735) amends Title 5 of the United States Code to establish an Office of Inspector General within the Executive Office of the President and restricts the reasons for which Inspectors General can be removed from office. The bill mandates the President appoint an Inspector General for the Executive Office of the President and limits removal of Inspectors General to cases of inefficiency, malfeasance, or neglect of duty. The bill also includes a technical amendment relating to the force and effect of prior legislation.
